data.title: Guest Services and Rules
data.text:
Stroller and Scooter Rentals

We offer four items for rent to help you get around:

Double strollers – $17

Wagons – $17

Manual Push Wheelchairs – $18

Motorized Scooters with Sunshade – $45

Wheelchair and motorized scooter rentals may be paid via credit card only. Members receive a $5 discount on motorized scooter rentals.

Note: You must be 18 or older to rent a motorized scooter.

Multiple food and beverage locations will be available along the path with limited food options. Food and beverage locations take cash and credit cards. Outside food, drink, and coolers are allowed. For the safety of the animals, guests may NOT bring:

Glass bottles

Alcoholic beverages

Plastic straws

The Zoo is open rain or shine, unless the severity of the weather poses a threat to the safety of our guests and staff (like a hurricane). If we do close for a major weather event, we will post the news on our website and the Zoo’s social media accounts. We do not offer rain checks or refunds due to inclement weather.

Service animals are welcome on Zoo grounds under the care of their owner. The Houston Zoo asks that all guests with service animals check in at our Safety and Security window (currently at the main entrance to the right of the ticket booths) to register their animal. Service animals must remain under their owner’s control at all times.

VIEW SERVICE ANIMAL MAP

Please note that emotional support animals, assistance animals, or companion animals are not allowed in the Zoo.

Yes. See our rental information above.

Note on scooters: The motorized scooter is a single person chair only. No children are allowed to ride on the operator’s lap. Operators must be 18 years of age or older. All operators between the ages of 18 and 21 must have a valid driver’s license and signature of a legal parent/guardian over the age of 21. Young children are not allowed to operate the chair.

The Hermann Park Railroad is not officially associated with Houston Zoo, and the train does not run within Zoo grounds. The train station is not far from the Zoo entrance in Hermann Park. For information and prices, visit the Hermann Park Conservancy’s Railroad and Pedal Boat webpage.
